intro: Angraecum elatum, commonly known as the slender spider orchid, is a terrestrial orchid native to Madagascar. It is characterized by its tall, slender stem and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom during the dry season. The plant has a fibrous root system and thrives in well-drained, sandy soils. It is adapted to arid environments and requires periods of drought to trigger flowering. Angraecum elatum is a rare and endangered species, making it a subject of conservation interest.
